text: The 1920 North Dakota blizzard was a severe blizzard that killed 34 people from March 15â€“18, 1920 in the U.S. state of North Dakota. == Severity == High winds and an eight-inch (20-centimeter) snowfall stopped rail service in Bismarck, North Dakota. Only one telephone line functioned between Fargo, North Dakota, and Minneapolis, Minnesota. Category:20th century in North Dakota Category:March events Category:1920 in the United States Category:Historic blizzards in the United States
title: 1920 North Dakota Blizzard
